column2: Last one up is a Cocoa baby! cried Raggedy Ann, as she scrambled to her feet.
column3: Last one up is a Cocoa baby! cried Raggedy Ann, as she scrambled to her feet.

column2: And with her skirts in her rag hands she went racing up the stairs to where the rest of the dollies stood laughing.
column3: And with her skirts in her rag hands she went racing up the stairs to where the rest of the dollies stood laughing.

column2: Hurrah, for Raggedy Ann! cried Raggedy Andy generously.
column3: Hurrah, for Raggedy Ann! cried Raggedy Andy generously.

column2: She won!
column3: She won!

column2: [Illustration: Raggedy Ann racing up the stairs]
column3: [Illustration: Raggedy Ann racing up the stairs]

column2: [Illustration: Listening to the seashell]
column3: [Illustration: Listening to the seashell]

column2: [Illustration: The Singing Shell]
column3: [Illustration: The Singing Shell]

column2: THE SINGING SHELL
column3: THE SINGING SHELL

column2: For years and years the beautiful shell had been upon the floor in Gran'ma's front room.
column3: For years and years the beautiful shell had been upon the floor in Gran'ma's front room.

column2: It was a large shell with many points upon it. These were coarse and rough, but the shell was most beautiful inside.
column3: It was a large shell with many points upon it. These were coarse and rough, but the shell was most beautiful inside.

column2: Marcella had seen the shell time and time again and often admired its lovely coloring, which could be seen when one looked inside the shell.
column3: Marcella had seen the shell time and time again and often admired its lovely coloring, which could be seen when one looked inside the shell.

column2: So one day, Gran'ma gave the beautiful shell to Marcella to have for her very own, up in the nursery.
column3: So one day, Gran'ma gave the beautiful shell to Marcella to have for her very own, up in the nursery.

column2: It will be nice to place before the nursery door so the wind will not blow the door to and pinch anyone's fingers! Gran'ma laughed.
column3: It will be nice to place before the nursery door so the wind will not blow the door to and pinch anyone's fingers! Gran'ma laughed.

column2: So Marcella brought the shell home and placed it in front of the nursery door.
column3: So Marcella brought the shell home and placed it in front of the nursery door.

column2: Here the dolls saw it that night, when all the house was still, and stood about it wondering what kind of toy it might be.
column3: Here the dolls saw it that night, when all the house was still, and stood about it wondering what kind of toy it might be.

column2: It seems to be nearly all mouth! said Henny, the Dutch doll.
column3: It seems to be nearly all mouth! said Henny, the Dutch doll.

column2: Perhaps it can talk.
column3: Perhaps it can talk.

column2: It has teeth! the French doll pointed out.
column3: It has teeth! the French doll pointed out.

column2: It may bite!
column3: It may bite!

column2: I do not believe it will bite, Raggedy Andy mused, as he got down upon his hands and knees and looked up into the shell.
column3: I do not believe it will bite, Raggedy Andy mused, as he got down upon his hands and knees and looked up into the shell.

column2: Marcella would not have it up here if it would bite! And, saying this, Raggedy Andy put his rag arm into the lovely shell's mouth.
column3: Marcella would not have it up here if it would bite! And, saying this, Raggedy Andy put his rag arm into the lovely shell's mouth.

column2: It doesn't bite!	It doesn't bite!
column3: true

column2: I knew it wouldn't!" he cried.
column3: I knew it wouldn't!" he cried.

column2: Just feel how smooth it is inside!
column3: Just feel how smooth it is inside!

column2: All the dolls felt and were surprised to find it polished so highly inside, while the outside was so coarse and rough.
column3: All the dolls felt and were surprised to find it polished so highly inside, while the outside was so coarse and rough.

column2: With the help of Uncle Clem and Henny, Raggedy Andy turned the shell upon its back, so that all the dolls might look in.
column3: With the help of Uncle Clem and Henny, Raggedy Andy turned the shell upon its back, so that all the dolls might look in.

column2: The coloring consisted of dainty pinks, creamy whites and pale blues, all running together just as the coloring in an opal runs from one shade into another.
column3: The coloring consisted of dainty pinks, creamy whites and pale blues, all running together just as the coloring in an opal runs from one shade into another.

column2: Raggedy Andy, stooping over to look further up inside the pretty shell, heard something.
column3: Raggedy Andy, stooping over to look further up inside the pretty shell, heard something.

column2: It's whispering! he said, as he raised up in surprise.
column3: It's whispering! he said, as he raised up in surprise.

column2: All the dolls took turns putting their ears to the mouth of the beautiful shell.
column3: All the dolls took turns putting their ears to the mouth of the beautiful shell.

column2: Yes, truly it whispered, but they could not catch just what it said.
column3: Yes, truly it whispered, but they could not catch just what it said.

column2: Finally Raggedy Andy suggested that all the dolls lie down upon the floor directly before the shell and keep very quiet.
column3: Finally Raggedy Andy suggested that all the dolls lie down upon the floor directly before the shell and keep very quiet.

column2: If we don't make a sound we may be able to hear what it says! he explained.
column3: If we don't make a sound we may be able to hear what it says! he explained.

column2: So the dolls lay down, placing themselves flat upon the floor directly in front of the shell and where they could see and admire its beautiful coloring.
column3: So the dolls lay down, placing themselves flat upon the floor directly in front of the shell and where they could see and admire its beautiful coloring.

column2: Now the dolls could be very, very quiet when they really wished to be, and it was easy for them to hear the faint whispering of the shell.
column3: Now the dolls could be very, very quiet when they really wished to be, and it was easy for them to hear the faint whispering of the shell.

column2: This is the story the shell told the dolls in the nursery that night:
column3: This is the story the shell told the dolls in the nursery that night:

column2: A long, long time ago, I lived upon the yellow sand, deep down beneath the blue, blue waters of the ocean.	A long, long time ago, I lived upon the yellow sand, deep down beneath the blue, blue waters of the ocean.
column3: true

column2: Pretty silken sea weeds grew around my home and reached their waving branches up, up towards the top of the water.
column3: Pretty silken sea weeds grew around my home and reached their waving branches up, up towards the top of the water.

column2: [Illustration: Everyone listens]
column3: [Illustration: Everyone listens]

column2: Through the pretty sea weeds, fishes of pretty colors and shapes darted here and there, playing at their games.	Through the pretty sea weeds, fishes of pretty colors and shapes darted here and there, playing at their games.
column3: true

column2: It was still and quiet 'way down where I lived, for even if the ocean roared and pounded itself into an angry mass of tumbling waves up above, this never disturbed the calm waters down where I lived.	It was still and quiet 'way down where I lived, for even if the ocean roared and pounded itself into an angry mass of tumbling waves up above, this never disturbed the calm waters down where I lived.
column3: false

column2: Many times, little fishes or other tiny sea people came and hid within my pretty house when they were being pursued by larger sea creatures. And it always made me very happy to give them this protection.	Many times, little fishes or other tiny sea people came and hid within my pretty house when they were being pursued by larger sea creatures. And it always made me very happy to give them this protection.
column3: false

column2: They would stay inside until I whispered that the larger creature had gone, then they would leave me and return to their play.	They would stay inside until I whispered that the larger creature had gone, then they would leave me and return to their play.
column3: true

column2: Pretty little sea horses with slender, curving bodies often went sailing above me, or would come to rest upon my back.	Pretty little sea horses with slender, curving bodies often went sailing above me, or would come to rest upon my back.
column3: true

column2: It was nice to lie and watch the tiny things curl their little tails about the sea weed and talk together, for the sea horses like one another and are gentle and kind to each other, sharing their food happily and smoothing their little ones with their cunning noses.
column3: It was nice to lie and watch the tiny things curl their little tails about the sea weed and talk together, for the sea horses like one another and are gentle and kind to each other, sharing their food happily and smoothing their little ones with their cunning noses.

column2: But one day a diver leaped over the side of a boat and came swimming head-first down, down to where I lay.	But one day a diver leaped over the side of a boat and came swimming head first down, down to where I lay.
column3: true

column2: My!
column3: My!

column2: How the tiny sea creatures scurried to hide from him.
column3: How the tiny sea creatures scurried to hide from him.

column2: He took me within his hand and, giving his feet a thump upon the yellow sand, rose with me to the surface.
column3: He took me within his hand and, giving his feet a thump upon the yellow sand, rose with me to the surface.

column2: He poured the water from me, and out came all the little creatures who had been hiding there!
column3: He poured the water from me, and out came all the little creatures who had been hiding there!

column2: Raggedy Andy wiggled upon the floor, he was so interested.
column3: Raggedy Andy wiggled upon the floor, he was so interested.

column2: Did the tiny creatures get back into the water safely? he asked the beautiful shell.
column3: Did the tiny creatures get back into the water safely? he asked the beautiful shell.

column2: Oh, yes! the shell whispered in reply.
column3: Oh, yes! the shell whispered in reply.

column2: The man held me over the side of the boat, so the tiny creatures went safely back into the water!
column3: The man held me over the side of the boat, so the tiny creatures went safely back into the water!

column2: I am so glad! Raggedy Andy said, with a sigh of relief.
column3: I am so glad! Raggedy Andy said, with a sigh of relief.

column2: He must have been a kindly man!
column3: He must have been a kindly man!

column2: Yes, indeed! the beautiful shell replied.
column3: Yes, indeed! the beautiful shell replied.

column2: So I was placed along with a lot of other shells in the bottom of the boat and every once in a while another shell was placed amongst us.	So I was placed along with a lot of other shells in the bottom of the boat and every once in a while another shell was placed amongst us.
column3: true

column2: We whispered together and wondered where we were going.
column3: We whispered together and wondered where we were going.

column2: We were finally sold to different people and I have been at Gran'ma's house for a long, long time."
column3: We were finally sold to different people and I have been at Gran'ma's house for a long, long time."

column2: You lived there when Gran'ma was a little girl, didn't you? Raggedy Ann asked.
column3: You lived there when Gran'ma was a little girl, didn't you? Raggedy Ann asked.

column2: Yes, replied the shell, "I have lived there ever since Gran'ma was a little girl.
column3: Yes, replied the shell, "I have lived there ever since Gran'ma was a little girl.

column2: She often used to play with me and listen to me sing."
column3: She often used to play with me and listen to me sing."

column2: Raggedy Ann can play 'Peter, Peter, Pumpkin Eater' on the piano, with one hand, said Uncle Clem, "but none of us can sing.
column3: Raggedy Ann can play 'peter, peter, Pumpkin Eater' on the piano, with one hand, said Uncle Clem, "but none of us can sing.

column2: Will you sing for us?" he asked the shell.
column3: Will you sing for us?" he asked the shell.

column2: I sing all the time, the shell replied, "for I cannot help singing, but my singing is a secret and so is very soft and low.
column3: I sing all the time, the shell replied, "for I cannot help singing, but my singing is a secret and so is very soft and low.

column2: Put your head close to the opening in my shell and listen!"
column3: Put your head close to the opening in my shell and listen!"

column2: The dolls took turns doing this, and heard the shell sing softly and very sweetly.
column3: The dolls took turns doing this, and heard the shell sing softly and very sweetly.

column2: How strange and far away it sounds! exclaimed the French doll.
column3: How strange and far away it sounds! exclaimed the French doll.

column2: Like fairies singing in the distance!	Like fairies singing in the distance!
column3: true

column2: The shell must be singing the songs of the mermaids and the water-fairies!"
column3: The shell must be singing the songs of the mermaids and the water fairies!"

column2: It is queer that anything so rough on the outside could be so pretty within! said Raggedy Andy.
column3: It is queer that anything so rough on the outside could be so pretty within! said Raggedy Andy.

column2: It must be a great pleasure to be able to sing so sweetly!
column3: It must be a great pleasure to be able to sing so sweetly!

column2: Indeed it is, replied the beautiful shell, "and I get a great happiness from singing all the time."
column3: Indeed it is, replied the beautiful shell, "and I get a great happiness from singing all the time."

column2: And you will bring lots of pleasure to us, by being so happy! said Raggedy Andy.
column3: And you will bring lots of pleasure to us, by being so happy! said Raggedy Andy.

column2: For although you may not enter into our games, we will always know that you are happily singing, and that will make us all happy!
column3: For although you may not enter into our games, we will always know that you are happily singing, and that will make us all happy!

column2: I will tell you the secret of my singing, said the shell.
column3: I will tell you the secret of my singing, said the shell.

column2: When anyone puts his ear to me and listens, he hears the reflection of his own heart's music, singing; so, you see, while I say that I am singing all the time, in reality I sing only when someone full of happiness hears his own singing as if it were mine.
column3: When anyone puts his ear to me and listens, he hears the reflection of his own heart's music, singing; so, you see, while I say that I am singing all the time, in reality I sing only when someone full of happiness hears his own singing as if it were mine.

column2: How unselfish you are to say this! said Raggedy Andy.
column3: How unselfish you are to say this! said Raggedy Andy.

column2: Now we are ever so much more glad to have you with us.	Now we are ever so much more glad to have you with us.
column3: true

column2: Aren't we?" he asked, turning to the rest of the dolls.
column3: Aren't we?" he asked, turning to the rest of the dolls.

column2: Yes, indeed! came the answer from all the dolls, even the tiny penny dolls.
column3: Yes, indeed! came the answer from all the dolls, even the tiny penny dolls.

column2: That is why the shell is so beautiful inside! said Raggedy Ann.
column3: That is why the shell is so beautiful inside! said Raggedy Ann.

column2: Those who are unselfish may wear rough clothes, but inside they are always beautiful, just like the shell, and reflect to others the happiness and sunny music within their hearts!
column3: Those who are unselfish may wear rough clothes, but inside they are always beautiful, just like the shell, and reflect to others the happiness and sunny music within their hearts!
